concept.title: High Availability for Client-Server Communication
concept.shortdesc: The native client provides reliable event messaging from cache server to client to prevent data loss during server failover operations. High availability is implemented in the cache server and is configured in the native client.

conbody.p: See for details about configuring a Java cache server for high availability.

note.p: High availability functions the same whether the region is partitioned or not. See for information about partitioned regions.
